org.apache.ambari.server.security.authentication

Class AmbariBasicAuthenticationFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.filter.GenericFilterBean
      • org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter
        • org.springframework.security.web.authentication.www.BasicAuthenticationFilter
          • org.apache.ambari.server.security.authentication.AmbariBasicAuthenticationFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter, AmbariAuthenticationFilter, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.context.EnvironmentAware, org.springframework.core.env.EnvironmentCapable, org.springframework.web.context.ServletContextAware

    @Component
 @Order(value=3)
public class AmbariBasicAuthenticationFilter
extends org.springframework.security.web.authentication.www.BasicAuthenticationFilter
implements AmbariAuthenticationFilter
    AmbariBasicAuthenticationFilter extends a BasicAuthenticationFilter to allow for auditing of authentication attempts

    This authentication filter is expected to be used withing an AmbariDelegatingAuthenticationFilter.

    See Also:
    AmbariDelegatingAuthenticationFilter

    • Method Detail

      • shouldApply

        public boolean shouldApply(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest)
        Tests to see if this AmbariBasicAuthenticationFilter should be applied in the authentication filter chain.

        true will be returned if the HTTP request contains the basic authentication header; otherwise false will be returned.

        The basic authentication header is named "Authorization" and the value begins with the string "Basic" following by the encoded username and password information.

        For example: Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=

        Specified by:
        shouldApply in interface AmbariAuthenticationFilter
        Parameters:
        httpServletRequest - the HttpServletRequest the HTTP service request
        Returns:
        true if the HTTP request contains the basic authentication header; otherwise false

      • shouldIncrementFailureCount

        public boolean shouldIncrementFailureCount()
        Description copied from interface: AmbariAuthenticationFilter
        Tests this AmbariAuthenticationFilter to see if authentication failures should count towards the consecutive authentication failure count.

        This should typically be false for remote authentication sources such as LDAP or JWT.

        Specified by:
        shouldIncrementFailureCount in interface AmbariAuthenticationFilter
        Returns:
        true if authentication failure should be counted; false, otherwise

      • doFilterInternal

        public void doFilterInternal(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,

                      throws IOException,

        Checks whether the authentication information is filled. If it is not, then a login failed audit event is logged
